required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CYstic Fibrosis bacterioPHage Study at Yale (CYPHY)
clinical_study.official_title: CYstic Fibrosis bacterioPHage Study at Yale (CYPHY): A Single-site, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of Bacteriophage Therapy YPT-01 for Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Infections in Adults With Cystic Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 2 study with primary objective of looking whether YPT-01 phage therapy reduces sputum bacterial load in cystic fibrosis subjects with Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
In addition, study evaluates the safety profile of phage therapy in this patient population.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded, single-site study of Yale Phage Therapy (YPT) 01 in cystic fibrosis subjects with chronic Pseudomonas aeruginosa airway infections. The study has 2 parallel arms of phage therapy and placebo, with all study materials GMP-manufactured. The purpose of this study is to demonstrate efficacy and safety of inhaled (nebulized) phage therapy YPT-01. Clinically stable subjects who have confirmed diagnosis of CF with PsA in sputum cultures on at least two occasions within past year, and in sputum at screening visit, will be recruited into this study.
An open-label extension is available for subjects in the placebo group to receive YPT-01 following completion of blinded portion of the study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Reduction in sputum bacterial culture titers of Pseudomonas as measured by colony forming units/mL at day 14

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, day 14, day 21, day 28, and day 56
secondary_outcome.description: Compare lung function [percent predicted forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1pp)] in subjects randomized to phage therapy and placebo at day 14, 21, 28, and 56

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the rate of pulmonary exacerbations
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the rates of pulmonary exacerbations between subjects randomized to phage therapy versus placebo during the first 56 days of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the rate of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the rates of hospitalizations between subjects randomized to phage therapy versus placebo during the first 56 days of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the rate of acute antibiotic use
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the rates of acute antibiotic use between subjects randomized to phage therapy versus placebo during the first 56 days of the study

Compare the changes in subject-reported quality of life, using the CFQR, between subjects randomized to phage therapy versus placebo during the first 56 days of the study. This survey consists of 50 questions that relate to a subjects clinical condition and mental health. Administration time takes 10 minutes

arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to receive 3mL phage therapy, nebulized daily for 7 days.
Participants will be randomized to receive the 3mL placebo, nebulized daily for 7 days.

intervention.description: Participants will be randomized to receive the standard dose of phage therapy YPT-01.
Participants will be randomized to receive the placebo.
